review: I've had the Fire TV Stick for a couple of weeks now.  While setup was easy and it seems to work with Prime.  It does NOT WORK WITH NETFLIX.  It is supposed to.  There is no fix despite many people reporting the same problem.  The only recommendations involve "reboots" and those don't even work.  This needs to be fixed for me to be even a little satisfied with my purchase.
author: R. Pugh

review: I love everything about except Hulu plus the screen freezes while watching
author: Amazon Customer

review: I already had the Chromecast.  I purchased the Fire TV Stick to compare, and because I am a Prime member I thought it would be to my advantage.  My issues/opinions:- It doesn't stream as well as the Chromecast.  It is constantly pausing and loading where the Chromecast does not.  Using Netflix it paused so often that I took out the Fire Stick and put the Chromecast in - no more issues and I was able to watch the movie all the way through (I say that to say, it is NOT my WiFi)- I also find that having to plug it into the wall instead of the tvs usb a cord now has to be dealt with: where with the Chromecast I can simply plug it into the tv and no concerns about the wiring.
author: Video Corporation of America

review: I ordered the Fire TV Stick in October of 2014 when they were first released for $20. When I received it I wasn't expecting much, but what a surprise when I set it up and started loading apps and watching television and movies. WOW! very impressed. I love the portability of it. I only wish I had purchased more at the time and had given them as gifts.
author: James C. Ohaver

review: Exceeded my expectations. Very simply to set up and use

review: I LOVE THE STICK!!! Awesome product. Was super easy and quick to set up and install. I highly recommend it! review: I got this because it was $20.  It really is only useful if you have Prime.  The interface is fine and the device works but it is not customizable and it really doesn't fit with Apple share unless you buy the correct app.  I also hate the device for typing, so that's why I want to use my Ipad.  This probably would be WAY more useful for someone with a Fire device.  But, I am still happy with it because it does work just like advertized.  e
